author: dapplion
content:
<@360491619402776577> what happens if multiple CLs connect to Geth's engine API and provide conflicting fork choice states? Specifically
- Rollback head to parent of current head
- Change safe cp to different branch
- Change finalized cp to different branch

If the forkchoice state is not compatible will it stop block production?

author: dapplion
content: Does Geth expose the full fork-choice state in some way? i.e. are the safeBlockHash and finalizedBlockHash available through some API?

author: m.kalinin
content:
> - Rollback head to parent of current head
Spec allows for returning `VALID` in this case and skipping the forkchoice state update (and not initiating the build process), geth is utilizing this opportunity AFAIR

> - Change safe cp to different branch
> - Change finalized cp to different branch
It should be fine as long as they are on the same chain with the head. Otherwise, the forkchoice update must not be applied

author: dapplion
content: So passing a head that's old from EL point of view will prevent block production?
